body: LEAD: The weekend was saved for beachgoers in Brooklyn yesterday as New York City park officials reopened Coney Island and Brighton beaches. But eight beaches on Staten Island and in Suffolk, Nassau and Westchester Counties remained closed because of medical waste or high bacteria counts. title: Park Officials Reopen 2 Brooklyn Beaches

body: LEAD: All the municipal beaches on Staten Island and in Brooklyn were closed yesterday when sewage gushed into New York Harbor after a power failure at a sewage-treatment plant, adding new concerns for beachgoers and health officials already alarmed by recent deposits of medical waste on the local shoreline. title: Beaches on Brooklyn and S.I. Close as Sewage Hits Harbor

body: LEAD: Bargains in Beef The Nevada Market has been one of the best butchers on the West Side since 1948, changing only its address (from Columbus Avenue and 68th Street to Broadway and 68th Street in 1960), not its high standards. title: FOOD NOTES

body: LEAD: The Flavors of Kansas The Flavors of Kansas Without even having to say ''There's no place like home,'' you can get a good taste of Kansas in Bloomingdale's food department through June 18. title: Food Notes

body: LEAD: FOR MANY MUSICIANS, NEW YORK ISN'T the center of the world - it's more like a far-flung suburb of Port-au-Prince or Athens, Bogota or Dublin. Ethnic communities here are magnets for the music of the old country and nothing, except perhaps the smell of home cooking, stirs memories and reinforces roots like local music. title: STEPPING OUT

body: LEAD: A Polish-born Jew accused of wartime atrocities surrendered his United States citizenship before a Federal judge in Brooklyn yesterday and admitted that he brutalized Jewish prisoners in a Nazi forced-labor camp and later entered this country illegally. title: A Jew Who Beat Jews in a Nazi Camp Is Stripped of His Citizenship
